revised_title: Aluminium as an Electrode in Cells for Direct and Alternate Currents: Resistance and Electromotive Force
tldr: The author investigates the resistance and electromotive force of aluminium as an electrode in cells containing electrolytes like alum and finds that the resistance is significantly higher when aluminium is used as an anode in direct currents, while it is negligible when used as a cathode or with alternate currents.
